newsitem.title: USA: OPTIONS - Dollar vols pared as spot stabilizes.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - Dollar vols pared as spot stabilizes.

text.p: Implied volatilities for dollar-pair options retreated in U.S. trading Tuesday as the dollar steadied after a two-day selloff.
"There has been a lot of selling of yen volatility across the curve, in two, three and six months," said an options trader for a U.S. brokerage firm.

He said market participants were looking for dollar/yen to settle into a band between 117.00 and 121.00 yen. "People are thinking the dollar is going to be rangebound," he said, but added that a fresh dip to 117.50 would reignite concern.
The dollar was bid at 118.63 yen in early afternoon, near levels at midsession Monday.
A trader at a Japanese bank said the spot was still a little "shaky" and had the potential to push lower still, toward a test of important support around 115.00 to 114.50 yen.

As a result, said the trader, there was interest in buying one- and two-week dollar/yen options with high gamma. Shorter-dated options have higher gamma, which provides quicker premium acceleration when the spot moves.
Implied volatility for one-week dollar/yen options was 11.5/12.5 percent, down 1.2 point from the previous session.
One-month fell to 9.7/9.9 percent from 11.0/11.3 percent quoted Monday. Three-month was 9.4/9.6 percent and one-year 9.3/9.5 percent, registering softer declines as the curve's inversion narrowed.

Dollar/mark volatilities edged back, with the curve essentially flat as the spot hovered around 1.6955 marks. One-month fell to 8.8/8.95 percent from 9.0/9.2. Tthree-month was 8.7/8.8 percent and one-year 8.65/8.8 percent.
"People are not really panicking in dollar/mark as they were in dollar/yen," said the Japanese bank trader.

Mark/yen volatility, however, retained a strong bid, holding at 9.7/10.1 percent for one-month options as the focus remained on the downside after the cross on Monday broke through major support at 70.00, traders said.
One-month 25-delta dollar/pair risk reversals narrowed their currency call skew to 0.8/1.1 for yen calls and flat/0.3 for mark calls.
